bioghist.p: Edward Bland Paisley (1890-1968), a Presbyterian pastor and educator, studied at Arkansas College, Austin Presbyterian Theological Seminary, University of Texas, and Yale. Paisley was the Educational Secretary of the Executive Committee on Home Missions, Secretary of the Board of Christian Education's Graduate Christian Education department, and a professor and later president of the Assemblyâ€™s Training School for Lay Workers among several other positions. He was affiliated with the PCUS and the PCUSA.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of professional and personal papers of Edward Paisley. The collection includes incoming and outgoing correspondence, minutes, and reports related to Paisley's work with the Graduate Christian Education department of the BCE; correspondence, lecture notes, and printed educational materials related to his work with the General Assembly's Training School for Lay Workers; reports, annual meeting programs, and board of trustee minutes (1946-1949) of the International Council of Religious Education; and minutes, proposed lesson plans, and publicity materials from the Commission on Education. The collection also includes general and personal correspondence files, 1932-1943; typescripts of speeches and addresses made by Paisley; manuscripts by Paisley and others; and printed catechisms and Presbytery manuals.
